Key Match Events: Taylor Ward started the offensive run with a solo homer to bring it within five.
Zach Neto—up against the heat-throwing closer Josh Hader—could’ve tied the game with a man on first, but ultimately couldn’t capitalize.
Pre-Game Insights: The Angels began an end-of-week series against the always-favored Houston Astros on Friday.
Post-Match Reflections: The Angels record dropped to 60-90 after the swept and lost the first game of a three game series to the MLB-worst 36-115 Chicago White Sox.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Catcher Logan O’Hoppe had a great showing with two hits, one RBI and scoring a run.
In his last 15 games, Ward has produced a.302 average,.696 slugging percentage and six homers.
Others: The Angels will hope for a turnaround series against one of the worst baseball teams of all time.
